title: Riot you have too many stupid players. Why do the rest of us have to suffer?
body: I think playing poorly should be completely reportable. An option for "very bad judgement and decision making" should be allowed in the lobby and if player gets too many of those, they should have to fucking do remediation in normals. I am sick of playing ranked with teammates who don't care about ranked, winning, or are not focused.

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in video games, it's not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

How bad is too bad? And who decides?

Is [this game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2610746979/239021279?tab=stats), where you went 2/9, did the second least damage on your team, died multiple times past river while only placing 11 wards in a 36 minute game (suggesting you either didn't buy any/very few control wards, confirmed by your build), had the lowest non-support/jg cs on both your or the enemy team, about 90 less than your lane partner... Need I go on?

There's too many statistics to reliably determine if someone's "bad enough" to get punished or remediation. I did the above to illustrate how hard it'd be to determine if someone is "bad" based on the statistics, or reports. It doesn't seem so good when [you're](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2612374930/239021279?tab=overview) [the](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2611027193/239021279?tab=overview) [one](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2610555759/239021279?tab=overview) [getting](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2609657988/239021279) [looked at](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2610734854/239021279?tab=overview).. does it?

Point being, you can find games anyone's playing that look bad. Do you want to have to "remediate" just because I can pull out bad statistics/deaths in those games, or because people were mad at you and reported you?

Cool, everyone has a bad match. But the numbers don't tell the whole story. Most likely my lane was fine and another lane or lanes fed early and those deaths came from me trying to help them against all the fed champions that they fed.  

But maybe I deserved to get reported that match. But clearly, if you were to actually think before you typed, it would have be something where you get enough reports from enough players within a certain amount of matches in order to trigger a punishment.  

Next time you want to post, try to grasp what a person is saying before you smugly throw in your ego driven 2 cents.

So, I pulled out 6 different games where itâ€™s quite reasonable someone decided to report you for your score, statistics, or play.

How many is too many? 6 out of your last 50 or so games that I looked through? Who decides? Would you be willing to get punished?
